channel.title: Making a backflip emote
channel.description: is it possible to make one? just wondering :P

item.title: Making a backflip emote
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

jamessemple:

is it possible to make one? just wondering

Yes, it’s possible, only problem is that the drawing priority for the legs is lower than the body, so the legs would dissapear. Try doing a simple emote to kick yourself in the head, like weeman, that should show you the problem.

Jagex replace the models for legs during some emotes, which is stuipid coz you have to remodel ALL legs, they should have put triangle priorities in with the animation system.

Really depends if you care whether the legs dissapear…

Read full topic

item.title: Making a backflip emote
item.dc:creator: @Goodbye_RS_Hello_RSP Goodbye RS, Hello RSPS
item.description:
@Goodbye_RS_Hello_RSP wrote:

[quote=“jamessemple, post:15, topic:312556”][quote author=lesterknome link=topic=408958.msg3032827#msg3032827 date=1258505593]

your retarded… yes i have a high experience within coding c++
last time i checked, creating an emote using client models had fucking nothing to do with this sort of thing

But if you really knew java, you would obviously know how to do this as well.
[/quote]
no lol i’m bad with modelling using programs like rsposer, gimp, blender, masq etc… which those are to do with graphics and client editing side…
I’m best on the server side.[/quote]

Your mocking yourself.

How does adding emotes have to do with models?

It’s creating frames for animating 3d models, you can do this with RSPoser.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a backflip emote
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

[quote=“Anfernio, post:6, topic:312556”][quote author=jamessemple link=topic=408958.msg3021968#msg3021968 date=1257643208]
true but what about making one for a 317? (delta)
[/quote]

dump the 525 emote and convert it so the 317 client can parse the data, then add the animation file (.dat extention)[/quote]
^that or you could make your own using rsposer.

Read full topic
